snippet: A plan to export eight chimps from a research center in Atlanta to a zoo in England is a first test of an endangered species listing that says that only actions that benefit chimpanzees as a species should be allowed.
abstract: Application to move eight chimpanzees from Yerkes National Primate Research Center at Emory University in Atlanta to Wingham Wildlife Park in England will be first test of new Fish and Wildlife Service restrictions limiting transfer of animals, which come close to ban on their use as medical research subjects; organization classified chimpanzees as endangered species in June.
lead_paragraph: A plan to export eight chimps from a research center in Atlanta to a zoo in England is a first test of an endangered species listing that says that only actions that benefit chimpanzees as a species should be allowed.

headline.main: Plan to Export Chimps Tests Law to Protect Species
headline.print_headline: Plan to Export Chimps Is First Test of New Measures to Protect the Species
